snippet: The company’s shares fell more than 21 percent on a day when the chief executive, Philippe P. Dauman, blamed “a lot of noise” for its recent decline.
abstract: Viacom reports quarterly profit of $449 million, drop of 10 percent from $500 million in quarter year earlier, and revenue of almost $3.2 billion, decline of 6 percent from previous year; reported losses, which add to concerns over leadership, leads chief executive Philippe P Dauman to challenge depiction of low performance and to defend his recent promotion to executive chairman.
lead_paragraph: The company’s shares fell more than 21 percent on a day when the chief executive, Philippe P. Dauman, blamed “a lot of noise” for its recent decline.

headline.main: Viacom Chief Is Defensive on Its Weak Earnings
headline.print_headline: Viacom Chief Is Defensive on Its Earnings
